fields.description:
I found the problem, but first, a small introduction to the issue:
Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc has a branded Android version, and a special camera (also camera software).

Basically Titanium crashes after taking a picture (result should be delivered to titanium), but then a Null Pointer Exception occurs.

It is very simple to reproduce, just invoke showCamera(), nothing else.

{code:lang=javascript}
Titanium.Media.showCamera({
	success:function(event) {},
	cancel:function()	{},
	error:function(error)   {},
	allowEditing:true
});
{code}

Complete log of the device until crash can be found [here|http://pastebin.com/5C5JzBpG] and below:

{code}


Issue is caused by a bug in [MediaModule.java:onResult:L247|https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/blob/master/android/modules/media/src/ti/modules/titanium/media/MediaModule.java#L247]

Please read the comments in the following for the solution:

{code:lang=javascript}
public void onResult(Activity activity, int requestCode, int resultCode, Intent data)
{
if (resultCode == Activity.RESULT_CANCELED) {
//....
} else {
	// Problem begins here
	
	if (data == null) {
		// Some code.. 
		
	} else {
		

		// ... more code
		
		Cursor c = activity.getContentResolver().query(data.getData(), projection, null, null, null);
		// on the Xperia ARC the cursor is NULL, I can't tell why

		if (c != null) {
		
			// the variable dataPath is initialized for the first time in this block, but this code
			// part is never reached for the Xperia Arc
		}

		// Therefor dataPath is NULL, that's why a NPE occurs later on
		// There is no error handling for a null cursor, but code after this line
		// totally expects it to have done its job...
		
		String localImageUrl = dataPath;
              	
	}
	}
}
{code}

My workaround for this was: 
Check if cursor will be null, if so, then ignore the passed data, and go right into the EXTRA_OUTPUT codeblock..
Not clean, but at least it works.

Also you should get an Xperia arc, as there are other bugs
(Kitchensink crashes, tap from dashboard opens the application several times instead of opening the existing ones, etc...)

Thanks
fields.summary: Android: Camera crashes Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc Android 2.3.2, 2.3.3 with all branches
fields.environment:
* Real device, Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc, Android 2.3.2 (also 2.3.3)
* Android 2.1-update1 SDK
* Titanium SDK 1.6.* 1.7.* 1.8.* all exhibit the issue

comments.body:
Patric

Thank you for this ticket. Please note the changes I made to improve it. One useful tip is that it's always good to have code and logs in the ticket rather than to provide a link. A jira markup code block is good for this.

I have now moved this ticket to the proper project.

Cheers

I am not sure but it is possible that this bug affects several Xperia devices (Arc, Arc S, SK17i, ...).
It would be a great improvement to avoid this crash !

It is opened since July 2011 and nothing seems to be planned to fix this...

Many users are complaining about this on our Android app.
Here is a list of devices (all are Xperia) in which crashes happen :
Xperia Arc X10 (X10i),
Xperia Arc S (LT18i),
Xperia Ray (ST18i),
Xperia Mini Pro (SK17i),
Xperia Arc X12 (LT15i),
Xperia U (ST25i),
Xperia Active (ST17i)

It may affects all Xperia devices.

Moreover, this bug is still present for new SDK versions :
our new app version is using the Titanium SDK 2.1.1.GA and the crashes remain.

Same issues for me (with SDK 2.1.1.GA).
And it's quite annoying since my app can't work anymore without this functionality...

Hi guys, 

is it planned to have this bug fixed anytime soon ? It's really annoying since my app is based on taking pictures. It's been a year since this ticket has been opened and nothing seems to have been done. 

Cheers,

Hi,

I have to solve this issue too but i can't find the right file "MediaModule.java" in the Titanium sdk folder "AppData\Roaming\Titanium\mobilesdk\win32\2.1.3.GA".

Can somebody help me ?

Resolving as duplicate. Should be fixed with fix for TIMOB-12848
 
https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/3992
Closing ticket as duplicate with reference to the linked issues above.
